div.h2: TUITION-FREE PUBLIC SCHOOLS OPEN TO ALL STUDENTS

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-a8c6011 elementor-widget elementor-widget-global elementor-global-9267 elementor-widget-alert

div.span: IDEA Public Schools is preparing to offer distance learning the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. This means our school buildings will remain closed except for meals and childcare. We will continue to monitor the situation throughout the summer and hope to reopen our school buildings in August 2020. Get more information and resources at ideapublicschools.org/parents/health-services.

div.p: Interested in learning more about student enrollment, career opportunities and other ways to get involved at IDEA?

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-8c308d3 elementor-align-left animated-slow elementor-mobile-align-center elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-button

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-64a13b1 elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-items-middle elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: From Pre-Kinder to 12th grade, IDEA Public Schools is focused on sending 100% of our kids to college.

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-fa96cfe elementor--h-position-center elementor--v-position-middle elementor-arrows-position-inside elementor-pagination-position-inside elementor-widget elementor-widget-slides

div.div: IDEA is open to all students and will grow to 123 schools in 2020.
For 13 years in a row, 100% of our seniors have been accepted to colleges and universities nationwide.
By 2022, IDEA will educate more than 100,000 students across the country.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-1a48497 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: It is the policy of IDEA Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its vocational programs, services or activities as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. As required by Texas Education Code 38.006 and 38.007, IDEA Public Schools maintains an alcohol-free and tobacco-free work environment.
Board Meetings & Agenda | Finance & Budget | Health Related Policies | CTE Non-Discrimination Statement | Annual Reporting

IDEA Public Schools National Board Members: Al Lopez – Chair, Xenia Garza – Chair-Elect, Ed Rivera – Treasurer, Ryan Vaughan – Secretary, Michael Burke, Preston Castille, Reba Cardenas McNair, David Earl, David Handley, Erich Holmsten, Bill Martin, Gabe Puente, Michael Rhodes, Victoria Rico, Saam Zarrabi, Collin Sewell
